statement.p: A swimmer is doing laps back and forth in a 50-meter long pool; she is maintaining a constant speed of 0.8 meters per second.

li.p: Explain why it takes her 62.5 seconds to swim one length of the pool. How long does it take her to swim one full lap (back and forth)?
Sketch a graph of her velocity function v(t) over, say, four laps; notice that her velocity switches from positive to negative when she touches the far wall and turns to swim back.
Use your graph to explain why \displaystyle\int_{t=0}^{125} v(t)\ dt = 0.
What is the meaning of the value of the definite integral in part (c)?
In 125 seconds at a constant speed of 0.8 meters per second, the swimmer covered a total distance of 100 meters. Why then did you get something very different in part (c)?
